text.content:
It is highly recommended to use the Koboldworks Data Inspector module to help find actor variables and their data types.

To use a variable in a formula field, it should start with @, then followed by each step in the tree, followed by a period, until the end is reach, i.e. @abilities.cha.value.

Some have predefined shortenings:

  • @prof

  • @level

How do I get custom archetypes to show in the Archetype Selection Dialogue?

To get an archetype not in the system compendium to display Archetype Selection Dialogue (fig. 1), do the following:

  1. Create your custom archetype, with the class (or custom class) selected in the Archetype Properties tab.

  2. Place your custom archetype in a self-made compendium that contains only Archetypes.

  3. Turn on "Automatically Apply Fancy Sheets to Compendium" in the Level Up Settings (fig. 2).

Figure 1: Archetype Selection Dialogue

Figure 2: Level Up Settings
